creator: rabidsquirrel21@hotmail.com
text:
The Windows 2000 (Professional) server that I have apache running on suddenly 
restarts when I download files from its administrative share (ie. 
\\apacheserver\d$). I can copy about 15MB to my workstation before the server 
resets. It doesn't seem to happen with a normal share, only that admin ones. 
The server instantly goes to POST. It doesn't shut down windows or go through 
the restart process. Instant blank screen and POST a few seconds later. If I 
stop the apache service this doesn't happen. 

Its a plain install, no additional 3rd party add-ons. Workstation is Windows 
XP. I tried logging in with multiple accounts and it still happens no matter 
what account is used.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Whenever you close your own bug... please add what was wrong with your
  config, or what you did to work around the problem (or simply, what
  documentation to consult.)

  Thanks!

creator: rabidsquirrel21@hotmail.com
text:
Sorry about that :)

My Solution:
The problem was with Norton Anti-Virus 2002. When I disabled its real time 
monitoring the admin shares worked fine. I have since Uninstalled NAV because 
of this.
